Research Projects

Robust Full-Body 3D Human Pose Estimation

Master's Research | African Institute of Mathematical Sciences | Sept 2024 - July 2025

Developing a composition of experts framework that combines SMPLest-X, WiLoR, and EMOCA for real-time full-body reconstruction. The system performs parameter-level fusion to achieve superior hand and face details compared to existing baselines like FrankMocap. This research addresses challenges in robust 3D human pose estimation from monocular images.

Technologies: Python, PyTorch, SMPL-X model

[Publication]

Detection and Classification of Tomato Diseases Using Informed CNNs

Engineering Capstone Project | Benin | July - Dec 2023

Designed a deep convolutional neural network with a novel initialization method for convolutional filters based on phytopathology expertise. The project focused on detecting and classifying diseases affecting tomato crops in Benin, with emphasis on neural network interpretability and fidelity evaluation to ensure reliable agricultural applications.

Technologies: Python, TensorFlow, Keras

[Publication]

Modeling Rainfall Using Recurrent Neural Networks

Supervised Project | Benin | Jan - Mar 2023

Developed deep recurrent neural network models to predict rainfall patterns in the Ouémé Basin at Savè. The project involved comprehensive study of RNN architectures, with special attention to neural network interpretability and uncertainty quantification to provide reliable weather predictions for agricultural planning.

Technologies: Python, TensorFlow, Excel

[Report]

More project details and code repositories will be added as they become publicly available.
